neighbors.name: SP Bennet Lake Development, LLC
neighbors.claims: SP Bennet Lake Development, LLC is associated with Scannell Properties and is developing a large industrial site in Wyandotte County, Kansas City, KS, known as the Scannell 435 Logistics Center at 9822 Leavenworth Road ([www.windowanddoor.com](https://www.windowanddoor.com/news/marvin-selects-kansas-city-new-manufacturing-facility#:~:text=Marvin%20has%20begun%20earthwork%20for,in%20Kansas%20City%20by%202028)). The company’s project broke ground in 2023 and secured Marvin as an anchor tenant, with a 400,000 sq. ft. manufacturing facility now under construction on the property ([www.windowanddoor.com](https://www.windowanddoor.com/news/marvin-selects-kansas-city-new-manufacturing-facility#:~:text=Marvin%20has%20begun%20earthwork%20for,in%20Kansas%20City%20by%202028)) ([lbmjournal.com](https://lbmjournal.com/marvin-opens-new-manufacturing-facility/#:~:text=Since%20beginning%20construction%20on%20the,by%20the%20close%20of%202028)). No individual principals are publicly listed for this LLC; it serves as a special-purpose entity for the land development, indicating out-of-state ownership (Scannell) rather than local community members ([www.windowanddoor.com](https://www.windowanddoor.com/news/marvin-selects-kansas-city-new-manufacturing-facility#:~:text=Marvin%20has%20begun%20earthwork%20for,in%20Kansas%20City%20by%202028)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Controls a major industrial development (~200+ acres); backed by a national developer (Scannell); landed a large employer (Marvin factory) with substantial investment

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with Scannell Properties’ project lead to align Helpen’s plans with their industrial park timeline; emphasize mutual economic benefits and proactively address any infrastructure or traffic concerns to avoid conflicts

neighbors.name: Marvin Lumber and Cedar Company, LLC
neighbors.claims: Marvin Lumber and Cedar Company, LLC (Marvin) is a family-owned window and door manufacturing firm founded in 1912 and based in Warroad, Minnesota ([lbmjournal.com](https://lbmjournal.com/marvin-opens-new-manufacturing-facility/#:~:text=in%20Kansas%20City%20by%20the,close%20of%202028)). In 2024, Marvin began constructing a 400,000 sq. ft. production facility in Kansas City, KS (Wyandotte County) to manufacture fiberglass windows and doors, partnering with Scannell Properties on the build and with strong support from state and local officials ([www.windowanddoor.com](https://www.windowanddoor.com/news/marvin-selects-kansas-city-new-manufacturing-facility#:~:text=Marvin%20has%20begun%20earthwork%20for,in%20Kansas%20City%20by%202028)) ([www.windowanddoor.com](https://www.windowanddoor.com/news/marvin-selects-kansas-city-new-manufacturing-facility#:~:text=%E2%80%9CKansas%20fought%20hard%20to%20win,%E2%80%9D)). Marvin chose the Kansas City area after a multi-state search, citing the skilled workforce and business-friendly climate, and local leaders praised the company for bringing quality jobs to the community ([www.windowanddoor.com](https://www.windowanddoor.com/news/marvin-selects-kansas-city-new-manufacturing-facility#:~:text=Marvin%20conducted%20an%20extensive%20search,contributed%20to%20Marvin%E2%80%99s%20final%20selection)) ([www.windowanddoor.com](https://www.windowanddoor.com/news/marvin-selects-kansas-city-new-manufacturing-facility#:~:text=%E2%80%9CI%20am%20excited%20to%20have,%E2%80%9D)). The new Marvin plant, estimated at $76.5 million investment, is expected to employ around 100 workers initially and grow to a 600-person workforce by 2028 ([www.windura.com](https://www.windura.com/marvins-hiring-in-a-kansas-city-near-you/#:~:text=Marvin%2C%20a%20leading%20name%20in,a%20Marvin%20certified%20installing%20retailer)) ([lbmjournal.com](https://lbmjournal.com/marvin-opens-new-manufacturing-facility/#:~:text=Since%20beginning%20construction%20on%20the,by%20the%20close%20of%202028)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Major new employer with planned 600 jobs; enjoys strong government and community support; significant capital investment in the county

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Kansas City plant manager or Marvin’s corporate liaison to ensure Helpen’s project poses no operational issues; highlight any shared interests (e.g. renewable energy supply or workforce development) to frame the development as complementary to Marvin’s local presence

overview_summary: Wyandotte County’s neighboring entities include a national real estate developer’s LLC and a major manufacturing company, each bringing significant projects. SP Bennet Lake Development, LLC – tied to Scannell Properties – has acquired and is developing a large industrial park that attracted Marvin’s new 400,000 sq.ft. window/door factory. Marvin Lumber and Cedar Company, LLC (Marvin) is a renowned family-owned window manufacturer establishing a big Kansas City, KS plant with strong state/local backing, likely making them supportive of growth and unlikely to join local opposition.
